results.title: The Bad sleep well = Warui yatsu hodo yoku nemeru
results.brief_description: Kurosawa’s first feature was released under the aegis of Kurosawa’s own production company. It is an impressive tale of greed, corruption and revenge and a powerful indictment of the dark side of business and politics with distinct overtones of “Hamlet”. Stars Toshiro Mifune. Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Bad and the beautiful
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, John Houseman and Vincente Minnelli
results.brief_description: The Bad and the beautiful casts a sharp eye on the studio system of Hollywood and its machinations. Legendary (mythical) Hollywood producer Jonathan Shields (Kirk Douglas) is a ruthless, amoral player in the film game, who has a slew of great films to his credit and a chorus of detractors to match. Shields’ rise to fame and power is told from three perspectives - the actress, the director and the writer. Each provides the audience with extensive flashback sequences that regale a story of their dealings with Shields. In each case Shields manipulated the individual for his own ends, to the detriment of his personal relationships. Douglas plays Shields as a charming authoritarian patriarch whose humanitarian misdeeds are to be forgiven in the name of art. Purportedly based on Darryl F. Zanuck (a key Hollywood player in the 1950s and 1960s), Shields could indeed reflect any number of megalomaniac studio heads. Directed by Vincenti Minelli, the film is a lush melodrama, typical of the MGM style of the 1950s and won numerous awards including five Oscars. Also starring: Lana Tuner, Walter Pidgeon, Dick Powell, Barry Sullivan and Gloria Grahame.

results.title: The Awful truth
results.brief_description: One of the classic screwball comedies of the 1930s, “The Awful truth” was nominated for six Academy Awards, winning an Oscar for director Leo McCarey. This was the third time the story had been brought to the screen, this version particularly working because of the improvisation encouraged of the cast and crew. The actors’ state of bewilderment and the humour born from this is reinforced by the fact that much of their dialogue is ad-libbed. The story centres around New York couple the Warriners (Cary Grant and Irene Dunne), who both suspect the infidelities of the other. They agree to a trial divorce, but cannot agree on who will get custody of their pet dog Mr Smith. What follows is a battlefield of witty dialogue, slapstick, sophisticated New York versus Southern manners and sublime bickering, while the Warriners attempt to sabotage each other’s new romances and ultimately try to reunite.

results.title: The Atomic Cafe
results.creator_credit: Archives Project Production Co, Kevin Rafferty, Jayne Loader and Pierce Rafferty
results.brief_description: A painstakingly researched and brilliantly edited compendium of pro-nuclear propaganda from American newsreels, ‘educational’ material, military footage, advertisements, TV shows and pop songs. This was the Cold War at its most icy and all-pervasive, and no area of American popular culture seems to have escaped from its bitter ideological grip. This veritable flood of bizarre, horrifying and often ludicrously comic images is counterpointed on the soundtrack by an array of equally extraordinary songs.

results.title: The Asphalt jungle
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Hornblow and John Huston
results.brief_description: Sam Jaffe plays a criminal mastermind, who, on his release from prison, develops a plan for executing the world’s biggest jewel heist. He assembles a crack team of thieves to assist him including wise-guy Sterling Hayden who is looking for one big chance at making money so he can escape the filth of New York City. Around a conventional film noir plot, John Huston fashions a stunning mise-en-scene that investigates the continuing shifting alliances and conflicts within the criminal underworld. Hayden makes a convincing noir hero and the supporting cast, including a young Marilyn Monroe, is uniformly excellent. Brilliantly lit and filmed, and with a taut script, “The Asphalt Jungle” is one of Huston’s best films; a classic example of a film that celebrates and challenges the conventions of the noir/gangster genre. Based on the novel by W.R. Burnett.

results.title: The Aristocats
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Wolfgang Reitherman and Winston Hibler
results.brief_description: Featuring the voices of Phil Harris and Eva Gabor, this Disney animated favourite is filled with lovable characters and “swingin’ music”. When an eccentric millionairess wills her entire estate to her pet cats, her greedy butler abandons them in the French countryside so he can inherit the money himself. Duchess and her three adorable kittens embark on an adventure-filled journey back to Paris, with a street-wise Casanova alley-cat named O’Malley.

results.title: The Apostle
results.creator_credit: Butchers Run Films, Rob Carliner and Robert Duvall
results.brief_description: Robert Duvall wrote, directed and stars in this tale of a deeply troubled Southern Pentecostal preacher, Sonny, which explores issues of spirituality and faith. Sonny is a gifted preacher much loved by his community, but after he loses control and commits a crime of passion, he is forced to flee from the law. Settling in the small town of Bay Boutte, he adopts a new identity and sets out on a new mission - to find the road to redemption. Cast includes: Robert Duvall, Farrah Fawcett, Miranda Richardson, Todd Allen and Billy Bob Thornton.

results.title: The Apartment
results.brief_description: This classic romantic comedy gave Jack Lemmon one of his best roles. Lemmon was ideally cast as an ambitious clerk in a big insurance company trying to gain promotion by renting out his apartment to senior executives for their extra-marital trysts. Everything goes according to plan until Lemmon falls in love with elevator operator Shirley Maclaine - and discovers that she is the mistress of his boss Fred MacMurray. The three central performances were perfect and Lemmon and Maclaine both received well deserved Oscar nominations. This multi-award winning movie is one to be seen again and again.

results.title: The Angelic conversation
results.creator_credit: BFI, James MacKay and Derek Jarman
results.brief_description: As fourteen of Shakespeare’s sonnets are being read we watch a young man isolated in a landscape of fierce physical terror. It is his confrontation with another man - at first antagonistic, then hesitant, and finally sexual - which liberates the man and his environment: rocks turn to water, physical struggle turns to creativity. This beautifully shot experimental film is a love poem dedicated to the artist’s muse; this time the love celebrated is between men and the artist’s liberation is defiantly homoerotic. The sonnets are read by Judi Dench. The atmospheric music score is by the avant-garde British group Coil.

results.title: The Andromeda strain
results.brief_description: Directed with clinical precision by Robert Wise, this record of the Earth’s first biological crisis is perhaps the most painstakingly authentic science fiction thriller ever made. When a satellite falls to earth near a remote New Mexico village, the recovery team finds everyone in the area dead except an infant and an old derelict. The survivors are brought to a five-storey underground lab - one of the most elaborate and intricate sets ever assembled in Hollywood - where scientists attempt to determine the nature of the deadly microbe before it starts a world-wide epidemic. Based on Michael Crichton’s bestselling novel that created national paranoia for its topical relevance to the first moon landing, this is a surprisingly accurate and scientific chiller.
